tuv.seg: How your income tax is calculated
An córas le cáin a mheas
• Tax rates and the standard rate cut-off point
• Rátaí cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
Nearly all income is liable to tax
Tá beagnach gach ioncam dlite ag cáin
Tax on income that you earn from employment is deducted from your wages by your employer on behalf of the Irish Government
Asbhaineann d'fhostóir cáin ar ioncam a thuilltear ó fhostaíocht ó do thuarastal ar son Rialtas na hÉireann
This is known as Pay As You Earn (PAYE)
Tugtar Íoc Mar a Thuillir (ÍMAT) ar an gcóras seo
The amount of tax that you have to pay depends on the amount of the income that you earn and on your personal circumstances
Braitheann an méid cánach a íocann tú ar an méid ioncaim a thuilleann tú agus ar do chúinsí pearsanta
There are a range of income tax reliefs available that can reduce the amount of tax that you have to pay
Tá raon faoiseamh ó cháin ioncaim atá in ann an méid cánach a chaithfidh tú a íoc a laghdú
The Universal Social Charge (USC) is a tax on your income
Is cáin ar do chuid ioncaim é an Muirear Uilíoch Sóisialach (MUS)
It is charged on your gross income before any pension contributions or PRSI
Gearrtar ar d’ollioncam é roimh rannaíocaíochtaí pinsin agus ÁSPC
You cannot use tax credits or tax relief (except for certain capital allowances) to reduce the amount you must pay
Ní féidir leat creidmheasanna cánach a úsáid le méid an mhuirir atá le híoc agat a laghdú
Find out more in our document on the Universal Social Charge
Tá daoine áirithe nach gcaithfidh an Muirear Uilíoch Sóisialach a íoc
Notice of determination of tax credits and standard rate cut-off point
Fógra cinnidh na gcreidmheasanna cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
At the start of the tax year, the Revenue Commissioners will send you a Notice of determination of tax credits and standard rate cut-off point
Ag tús na bliana cánach, seolfaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim Fógra cinnidh na gcreidmheasanna cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh chugat
Revenue will also send a summary of this certificate to your employer so that your employer can deduct the correct amount of tax
Léiríonn sé seo an ráta cánach a bhaineann le d'ioncam agus na creidmheasanna cánach a laghdaíonn an cháin iníoctha
If your circumstances change during the year Revenue will issue a revised certificate
Seolfaidh na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim achoimre den teastas seo chuig d'fhostóir ionas gur féidir leo an méid iomchuí cánach a asbhaint

If you are changing job or starting work for the first time, and your employer has not received this information from Revenue or a previous employer, you will be taxed on a temporary basis called emergency tax

Má tá tú ag athrú poist nó ag tosú ag tosú don chéad uair, agus nach bhfuil an fhaisnéis seo faighte ag d'fhostóir óna Coimisinéirí Ioncaim nó ón bhfostóir a bhí agat roimhe seo, gearrfar cáin ort ar bhonn sealadach ar a dtugtar cáin éigeandála
You can get more information about tax and starting work or changing job
Lean na naisc seo chun breis eolais a fháil faoi cáin agus ag tosú ag obair nó athrú poist
Tax rates and the standard rate cut-off point
Rátaí cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
Tax is charged as a percentage of your income
Gearrtar cáin ort mar chéatadán den ioncam atá agat
The percentage that you pay depends on the amount of your income
Braitheann an céatadán a íocann tú ar an méid ioncaim atá agat
The first part of your income, up to a certain amount, is taxed at 20%
Gearrtar cáin ag ráta 20% ar an gcéad chuid den ioncam, suas chomh fada le méid áirithe
This is known as the standard rate of tax and the amount that it applies to is known as the standard rate tax band
An ráta caighdeánach cánach a thugtar air seo agus is ráta caighdeánach an bhanda cánach a thugtar ar an méid lena mbaineann an ráta
The remainder of your income is taxed at the higher rate of tax, 40% in 2017
Gearrtar cáin ag an ráta ard cánach de 40% ar fhuílleach an ioncaim
The amount that you can earn before you start to pay the higher rate of tax is known as your standard rate cut-off point
Pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh a thugtar ar an méid is féidir leat a thuilleamh sula dtosaítear ag íoc an ráta ard cánach
See case studies for an example of how to calculate income using tax rates and the standard rate cut-off point
Féach ar cás-staidéir chun sampla a fháil conas ioncam a ríomh ag baint úsáide as rátaí cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh

Example of standard rate cut-off point for a married couple or civil partners with two incomes
Sampla de phointe scoite ráta caighdeáin do lanúin phósta ar dhá ioncam
In 2017, the standard rate cut-off point for a married couple or civil partners is €42,800
I 2017, is é an pointe scoite ráta caighdeáin do lánúin phósta ná €42,800
If both are working, this amount is increased by the lower of the following:
Má tá an bheirt ag obair, ardaítear an méid seo leis an méid is ísle de na méideanna a leanas:
• The amount of the income of the spouse or civil partner with the smaller income
• Méid ioncaim an chéile leis an ioncam is ísle
If one person is earning €48,000 and their spouse or civil partner is earning €25,000:
Má thuilleann duine €48,000 agus tuilleann a gcéile/páirtnéir sibhialta €25,000:
The standard rate cut off point for the couple is €42,800 plus €24,800
Is é scoithphointe an ráta chaighdeánaigh do lánúin ná €42,800 móide €24,800

The increase in the standard rate band is not transferable between spouses or civil partners, so the first spouse or civil partner's tax bands would be calculated as €42,800 @ 20% = €8,560 and €5,200 @ 40% = €2,080

Níl an méadú ar bhanda an ráta chánach chaighdeánaigh inaistrithe idir chéilí nó páirtnéirí sibhialta. Dá bhrí sin, d’íocfadh an chéad chéile nó pháirtnéir sibhialta €42,800 @ 20% = €8,560 agus €5,200 @ 40% = €2,080
The second spouse or civil partner's tax bands would be calculated as €24,800 @ 20% = €4,960 and €200 @ 40% = €80
D’íocfadh an dara chéile nó pháirtnéir sibhialta €24,800 @ 20% = €4,960 agus €200 @ 40% = €80
Tax credits reduce the amount of tax that you have to pay
Laghdaíonn creidmheasanna cánach an méid cánach a bhíonn ort a íoc
Tax credits are deducted after your tax has been calculated and so a tax credit has the same value to all taxpayers
Oibríonn siad seo ar bhealach atá difriúil ó liúntais chánach toisc go ndéantar iad a asbhaint tar éis do cháin a bheith ríofa - tá an luach céanna ag creidmheas cánach do gach cáiníocóir dá réir sin
After your tax is calculated, as a percentage of your income, the tax credit is deducted from this to reduce the amount of tax that you have to pay
Tar éis do cháin a bheith ríofa mar chéatadán den ioncam atá agat, déantar an creidmheas cánach a asbhaint ón méid seo chun an méid cánach a bhíonn ort a íoc a laghdú
So a tax credit of €200, for example, will reduce your tax by that amount
Mar shampla, laghdóidh creidmheas cánach €200 do chuid cánach den mhéid seo
You may be entitled to various tax credits depending on your personal circumstances
D'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal creidmheasanna cánach éagsúla ag brath ar do chúinsí pearsanta
You can get more information about the different types of tax credits and reliefs and the tax reliefs available for people with disabilities
Faigh amach faoi cineálacha difriúla creidmheasanna agus faoisimh chánach anseo agus féach ar faoisimh chánach atá ar fáil do dhaoine faoi mhíchumas anseo

If you are entitled to tax credits that are not listed on the Notice of determination of tax credits and standard rate cut-off point that you get from Revenue, you should contact Revenue to inform them

Má tá tú i dteideal creidmheasanna cánach nach bhfuil liostáilte ar Fógra cinnidh na gcreidmheasanna cánach agus pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh a fhaigheann tú ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim chun é a insint dóibh
Tax allowances reduce the amount of tax that you have to pay
Laghdaíonn liúntais chánach an méid cánach a bhíonn ort a íoc
The amount by which a tax allowance will reduce your tax depends on what your highest rate of tax is
Braitheann an méid lena laghdaíonn an liúntas cánach do cháin ar an ráta cánach is airde atá agat
This is because the allowance is subtracted from your income before it is taxed
Tá sé seo amhlaidh toisc go mbíonn an liúntas dealaithe ón ioncam sula ngearrtar an cáin
In effect, it is ‘taken off the top’ of your income which can then be taxed at either the standard rate or the higher rate, depending on your income level
Go bunúsach, tá sé 'tógtha ó bharr' d'ioncaim agus is féidir cáin a ghearradh air ag an ráta caighdeánach nó ag an ráta ard, ag brath ar an leibhéal ioncaim atá agat

If, for example, you have a tax allowance of €200 and your highest rate of tax is 20%, then this means that the amount of your income that is taxed at this rate is reduced by €200 and so your tax is reduced by €40 (€200 x 20%)

Mar shampla, má tá liúntas cánach €200 agat agus do ráta ard cánach ag 20%, ciallaíonn sé seo go bhfuil an méid ioncaim atá agat a ngearrtar cáin air ag an ráta seo laghdaithe de €200 agus laghdaítear do cháin de €40 dá réir (€200 x 20%)

If you have the same tax allowance of €200 but the highest rate of tax that you pay is 40%, then the amount of your income that is taxed at 40% is reduced by €200 and so your tax reduction is €80 (€200 x 40%)

Má tá an liúntas cánach céanna de €200 agat agus an ráta ard cánach a íocann tú ná 40%, gearrtar an cháin ar do chuid ioncaim ag 40% laghdaithe de €200 agus laghdaítear do cháin de €80 dá réir (€200 x 40%)
This is known as tax allowance at the marginal rate
Liúntas cánach ag an ráta imeallach a thugtar air seo
When your employer is taking allowances into account in calculating your income tax, the way that this is done is by adjusting your standard rate cut-off point
Nuair atá d'fhostóir ag tógáil liúntais san áireamh nuair atá do cháin ioncaim á ríomh, déantar é seo trí phointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh atá agat a choigeartú
Allowances at the marginal rate include:
I measc liúntais ag an ráta imeallach tá:
• Tax relief on employing a carer for an incapacitated person
• Faoiseamh cánach ar chostais leighis
• Tax relief on pension contributions
• Faoiseamh cánach ar chúramóir a fhostú do dhuine éagumasaithe
Before calculating your income tax, subtract the following from your income:
Sula ríomhann tú do cháin ioncaim, dealaigh na nithe a leanas ón ioncam atá agat:
• Payments to a Permanent Health Benefit Scheme (to a maximum of 10% of income)
• Íocaíochtaí isteach sa Bhuanscéim um Shochar Sláinte (suas go huasmhéid 10% d'ioncam)
This is a policy that will ensure continued income in the event of an accident, injury or sickness
Seo beartas a chinnteoidh ioncam leanúnach má tharlaíonn tionóisc, gortú nó tinneas
• Work expenses that were necessary to carry out your work duties
• Costais oibre a bhí riachtanach le do dhualgais oibre a chomhlíonadh
Your taxable pay is then taxed at 20% of income below the standard rate cut-off point
Gearrtar cáin ansin ar do phá incháinithe ag 20% den ioncam faoi phointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
The amount in excess of the cut-off point is taxed at 40%
Gearrtar cáin ag 41% ar an méid atá sa bhreis ar an bpointe scoite
This gives your Gross Tax
Tugann sé seo an Cáin Chomhlán duit
This could arise, for example, if most of your income is from your employer but you also have income outside this from which tax has not been deducted
Déantar luach na gcreidmheasanna cánach a dhealú ón méid seo ansin leis an méid cánach a bhíonn ort a íoc a thabhairt duit
Tax allowances have the effect of:
Is é éifeacht liúntais chánach ná:
• Increasing tax credits by the amount of the relief at the standard rate of tax
• Creidmheasanna cánacha a ardú trí mhéid an fhaoisimh ag ráta caighdeánach na cánach
This grants relief at the standard rate of tax
Tugann sé seo faoiseamh ag ráta caighdeánach na cánach
• Increasing the standard rate band by the amount of the relief
• Ag ardú banna an ráta chaighdeánach le méid an fhaoisimh
This adds the difference between relief at the higher rate of tax and the standard rate of tax
Cuireann sé seo leis an difríocht idir fhaoiseamh ag an ráta níos aidre cánach agus ráta caighdeánach na cánach
This ensures that relief is obtained in full at the higher rate of tax if applicable
Cinntíonn sé seo go bhfaightear faoiseamh iomlán ag an ráta níos airde cánach más infheidhmithe
For example, a tax allowance of €1,000 would have a value of €200 to a taxpayer on the standard rate and a value of €400 to a taxpayer on the higher rate
Mar shampla, bheadh luach de €200 ag liúntas cánach de €1,000 do cháiníocóir ar an ráta caighdeánach agus luach de €400 do cháiníocóir ar an ráta níos airde
The way this is calculated is to increase tax credits by €200 (1,000 x 20% standard rate of tax)
Ríomhtar é seo chun creimheasanna cánacha a ardú de €200 (1,000 x 20% ráta caighdeánach cánach)
This is the amount of the benefit to a standard rate taxpayer but the tax allowance would have a higher value for a taxpayer paying tax at the higher rate
Is é seo an méid leasa do cháiníocóir ar an ráta caighdeánach ach bheadh luach níos airde ag an gcáiníocóir ag íoc cánach ag an ráta níos airde
This is achieved by increasing the standard rate cut-off point by €1,000
Baintear amach é seo tríd an scothphointe ráta caighdeánach a ardú de €1,000

This means that for a higher rate taxpayer, €1,000 that would be taxed at a rate of 40% is instead taxed at 20%, a saving of €200 (€400 – 200 ) in addition to the €200 saved by the increase in tax credits

Ciallaíonn sé seo do cháiníocóir ráta níos airde, go mbeadh €1,000 a ngearrfaí cáin de 40% air go bhfuil cáin de 20% gearrtha air ina áit, sábháil de €200 (€400 – 200), maille leis an €200 sábháilte agus an t-ardú i gcreidmheasanna cánacha
The increase in the standard rate cut-off point would not effect a taxpayer already paying tax only at the standard rate so he/she would only benefit from the increased tax credits

Ní chuirfeadh an t-ardú scothphointe ráta caighdeánach isteach ar cháiníocóir atá ag íoc cánach ag an ráta caighdeánach amháin cheana, agus mar sin, bhainfeadh sé/sí leas as na creidmheasanna cánacha ardaithe
Benefits in kind and non-PAYE income have the opposite effect:
Is é a mhalairt d’éifeacht atá ag Sochar comhchineáil ioncam neamh-ÍMAT i ríomhaireachtaí:
• Decreasing tax credits by the amount of the income at the standard rate of tax
• Ag laghdú creidmheasanna cánacha ag méid an ioncaim ag an ráta caighdeánach cánach
• Decreasing the standard rate cut-off point by the amount of the income
• ag laghdú an scothphointe ráta caighdeánach trí mhéid an ioncaim
This has the opposite effect to the example above
Is é a mhalairt d’éifeacht atá aige seo don sampla thuas
In this case, €1,000 would decrease the tax credits by €200, affecting both standard and higher rate taxpayers
Sa chás seo, laghdódh €1,000 na creidmheasanna cánacha de €200, agus cur isteach ar idir cháiníocóirí ráta caghdeánach agus ráta níos airde
It would also decrease the standard rate cut-off point by €1,000 having the effect of increasing the tax liability for higher rate taxpayers only
Laghdódh sé freisin an scothphointe ráta caighdeánach de €1,000, a mbeadh éifeacht aige do dhliteanas cánach a ardú do cháiníocóirí ráta níos airde amháin
Marriage or civil partnership
Tosca a mbíonn tionchar acu ar phointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh
If you are married or in a civil partnership, this may affect your tax bands and tax reliefs
D'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal liúntais chánach a ardóidh pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh atá agat
More information can be found on our document Taxation of married people and civil partners
Nó d'fhéadfaí pointe scoite an ráta chaighdeánaigh atá agat a ísliú
You can find Revenue contact details for your region here
Féach ar Cúrsaí cánach do dhaoine pósta le haghaidh sonraí. Teagmháil
You can also view and update your tax details online
Is féidir leat freisin sonraí cánach a fheiceáil agus a nuashonrú ar líne
Income that is assessed for tax
Ioncaim a ndéantar measúnú air do cháin
Under the PAYE system, income tax is charged on all wages, fees, perks, profits or pensions and most types of interest
Faoin gcóras ÍMAT, gearrtar cáin ioncam ar gach pá, táille, peorcais, brabús nó pinsean, agus beagnach gach cineál úis

Tax is payable on earnings of all kinds that result from your employment (including for example, bonuses, overtime, non-cash pay or 'benefit-in-kind' such as the use of company car, tips, Christmas boxes and so forth)

Tá cáin iníoctha ar gach tuilleamh de gach cineál atá mar thoradh ar do chuid fostaíochta (san áireamh, mar shampla tá bónais, ragobair, pá nach airgead tirim é, sochar comhchineáil, ar nós úsáid cairr chomhlachta, aiscí, boscaí Nollag agus mar sin de)
Money you get which is not liable to income tax may be liable to other taxes
D’fhéadfaí go bhfuil airgead a fhaigheann tú nach bhfuil faoi dhliteanas cáin ioncaim faoi dhliteanas cánacha eile
If you get gifts or inheritances, you may have to pay Capital Acquisitions Tax
Má fhaigheann tú tabhartais nó oidhreachtúlachtaí d’fhéadfaí go mbeadh ort Cáin Fáltas Caipitiúil a íoc
If you sell assets such as property or shares you may have to pay Capital Gains Tax
Má dhíolann tú sochair ar nós réadmhaoine nó scaranna, d’fhéadfaí go mbeadh ort Cáin Ghnóthachan Caipitiúil a íoc
Income that may be exempt from tax includes the following:
Áirítear iad seo a leanas a d’fhéadfaí a bheith díolúinithe ó cháin:
• Payments to approved pension schemes
• Íocaíochtaí chuig scéimeanna pinsin ceadaithe
• Certain social welfare payments
• Roinnt íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
• Interest from savings certificates and Savings Bonds and National Instalment Savings Schemes, within limits
• Ús ó theastais shábhála agus Bannaí Coigiltis agus Scéim Náisiúnta Shábháil Ghála laistigh de theorainneacha
• Certain earnings by artists
• Tuilleamh ar leith d’ealaíóntóirí
• Certain payments in respect of disabilities linked with Thalidomide
• Íocaíochtaí ar leith i ndáil le míchumais gaolmhar le Tailídimíd
• Wins from licensed lotteries
• Íocaíochtaí ó chrannchuir cheadúnaithe
• Certain army pensions and allowances
• Pinsin agus liúntais arm ar leith
• Payments made by the Health Service Executive to foster parents for the care of foster children
• Íocaíochtaí ó Fheidhmeannas na Seirbíse Sláinte chuig tuismitheoirí altrama do chúram pháistí altrama
• Some compensation payments under employment law
• Roinnt íocaíochtaí cúitimh faoi dhlí fostaíochta
• Compensation for personal injury that prevents an individual from maintaining herself
• Cúiteamh do dhíobháil phearsanta a chuireann cosc ar dhuine aonair é féin a chothabháil
Income arising from the investment of such a payment is also exempt if it is the main source of income
Tá ioncam a eascraíonn óna léitheid d’íocaíocht díolmhaithe chomh maith más é an phríomhfhoinse ioncaim atá ann
Invalidity pension received as a result of the same injury is not included in assessing main income
Ní áirítear pinsean easláine a fuarthas mar thoradh ar an díobháil chéanna i measúnú an phríomhioncaim
If you are on low pay you may not be liable to pay any tax because your tax credits and reliefs are more than or equal to the amount of tax you are due to pay
Díolúine ioncaim íseal Tá díolúinte ó cháin ioncaim ar fáil má thiteann d’ioncam faoi leibhéal áirithe
(There is no income tax exemption for low income earners under 65.)
Má tá d’ioncam os cionn leibhéal áirithe d’fhéadfaí go mbainfeá leas as faoiseamh imeallach
You are completely exempt from income tax if you are over 65 and your income is below certain limits
Tá tú díolmhaithe go hiomlán ó cháin ioncaim má tá d’ioncam faoi na teorainneacha
Revenue provides information on Tax Exemption and Marginal Relief which details available exemption limits and tax relief
Tá tuilleadh eolais le fáil ar an mbileog Tax Exemption and Marginal Relief (IT 8) (pdf) ó na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
If your income exceeds the limits for low income exemption, but is less than twice the amount of the limit then you can claim marginal relief
Má sháraíonn d’ioncam na teorainneacha do dhíolúine ioncaim íseal, ach gur lú ná dhá oiread méid na teorann í, is féidir leat faoiseamh imeallach a éiliú
Under marginal relief, you are taxed only on the amount by which your income exceeds the limit, but a special tax rate of 40% applies to this amount
Faoi fhaoiseamh imeallach, gearrtar cáin ar an méid a sháraíonn an t-ioncam an teorann, ach tagann ráta speisialta de 40% i bhfeidhm ar an méid seo
Cormac is 66 years of age and is married
Tá Cormac 66 bliain d’aois agus tá sé pósta
His total income for 2016 was €40,000
Is é an t-ioncam iomlán atá aige do 2016 ná €40,000
Under the usual method of calculating his tax liability it would be €2,560 but under marginal relief it would be €1,600
Faoin ngnáthmhodh dá dhliteanas cánach a ríomh, ba €2,650 a bheadh i gceist ach faoi fhaoiseamh imeallach, bheadh €1,600 i gceist
Under the usual method the tax liability is calculated as follows:
Faoin ngnáthmhodh ríomhtar an dliteanas cánach mar a leanas:
The income is below the standard rate cut-off point so all of it is taxed at the standard rate of 20%
Tá an t-ioncam faoin scothphointe caighdeánach mar sin gearrtar cáin air ar fad agus an ráta caighdeánach de 20%
His tax credits are:
Is iad a chuid creidmheasanna cánacha ná:
The tax credits are subtracted from the gross tax to give the tax payable
Baintear na creidmheasanna cánacha ón ollcháin chun a cháin iníoctha a thabhairt
Under marginal relief the tax liability would be calculated as follows
Faoi fhaoiseamh imeallach ríomhfaí a dhliteanas cánach mar a leanas
Low income exemption limit: €36,000
Teorainn díolúine ioncaim íseal: €36,000
Gives €4,000 as the amount by which the income exceeds the limit
Tugann sé €4,000 ar an méid a sháraíonn an t-ioncam an teorainn
Marginal relief restricts the tax payable to 40% of this
Cúngaíonn faoiseamh imeallach an cháin iníoctha ar 40% de seo
Some work expenses can be deducted from your income before it is assessed for tax
Is féidir roinnt costais oibre a asbhaint as d’ioncam sula ndéantar measúnú air do cháin
To qualify, the expenses must be necessary in order to do your work and must have been spent entirely for that purpose and no other
Féach eolas na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim do thuilleadh sonraí ar chostais ar féidir a asbhaint chúiseanna cánacha
See Revenue for more information on expenses that can be deducted for tax purposes
Féach cásanna staidéir do shampla ar an gcaoi a infheidhmítear liúntais nuair a ríomhtar cáin ioncaim
